query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Di pari, come buoi che vanno a giogo, 2 m’andava io con quell’ anima carca, 3 fin che ’l sofferse il dolce pedagogo.
query.error: **English:** 1 Like oxen yoked together, 2 I went with that burdened soul, 3 until the gentle teacher endured it.
query.result: 1 Gelicost ðam oxan ðe gað ætgædere, 2 ic eode ða mid ðære sawle ðe wæs ðære byrðene, 3 oð ðæt ðe ðæt ðolige ðe ðone weg wisode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 dritto sì come andar vuolsi rife’mi 8 con la persona, avvegna che i pensieri 9 mi rimanessero e chinati e scemi.
query.error: **English:** 7 straight as one who wishes to go I set out 8 with my body, although my thoughts 9 remained behind, bowed down and weakened.
query.result: 7 rihte swa ðu wilt gan ic me eft gewende 8 mid ðam lichoman, ðeah ðe ða geðohtas 9 me wunedon æfter, gebigde and gebundene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Io m’era mosso, e seguia volontieri 11 del mio maestro i passi, e amendue 12 già mostravam com’ eravam leggeri;
query.error: **English:** 10 I had set out, and was following willingly 11 in my master's footsteps, and both of us 12 were already showing how light we were;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 ed el mi disse: «Volgi li occhi in giùe: 14 buon ti sarà, per tranquillar la via, 15 veder lo letto de le piante tue».
query.error: **English:** 13 and he said to me: "Turn your eyes downward: 14 it will be good for you, to quiet your way, 15 to see the bed of your soles."
query.result: 13 and he cwæð to me: "Bihæld ðine eagan niðer: 14 ðe bið betere, ðin weg to gestillan, 15 ðæt ðu ðinra fota wrixl gesio."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Come, perché di lor memoria sia, 17 sovra i sepolti le tombe terragne 18 portan segnato quel ch’elli eran pria,
query.error: **English:** 16 So that there may be memory of them, 17 above the buried ones the earthly tombs 18 bear a sign of what they were before,
query.result: 16 Þæt ðær ðara gemynd sie, 17 ofer ða byrgedan ða byrgena eorðan 18 berað betacnuð ðæs ðe hie ær wæron,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 onde lì molte volte si ripiagne 20 per la puntura de la rimembranza, 21 che solo a’ pïi dà de le calcagne;
query.error: **English:** 19 whence there many times one grieves 20 for the sting of remembrance, 21 which only to the pious gives spurs;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 sì vid’ io lì, ma di miglior sembianza 23 secondo l’artificio, figurato 24 quanto per via di fuor del monte avanza.
query.error: **English:** 22 thus I saw there, but of better semblance 23 according to the artistry, figured 24 as much as projects beyond the mountain's base.
query.result: 22 swa ic ðær geseah, ac beteran hiwes, 23 æfter ðam cræfte, geworht 24 swa fela swa ðurh ðæs muntes utweard scieneð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Vedea colui che fu nobil creato 26 più ch’altra creatura, giù dal cielo 27 folgoreggiando scender, da l’un lato.
query.error: **English:** 25 I saw the one who was nobly created, 26 more than any other creature, descend from heaven, 27 thundering down from one side.
query.result: 25 Ic geseah ðone ðe wæs æðele gesceaft, 26 selast ealra gesceafta, of heofonum 27 ligettende gefeallan, of ðam anum ende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Vedëa Brïareo fitto dal telo 29 celestïal giacer, da l’altra parte, 30 grave a la terra per lo mortal gelo.
query.error: **English:** 28 I saw Briareus, pierced in the body, 29 lying on the celestial side, 30 heavy on the earth because of the mortal frost.
query.result: 28 Ic geseah Briareus, ðone bodan bebyrged, 29 heofonlicne licgan, on ðære oðre healfe, 30 hefigne ðære eorðan ðurh ðone deadan ceald.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Vedea Timbreo, vedea Pallade e Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar le membra d’i Giganti sparte.
query.error: **English:** 31 I saw Mars, I saw Pallas and Timbreo, 32 still armed, around their father, 33 watching the limbs of the Giants scattered about.
query.result: 31 Ic geseah ðær Timbreon, ic geseah ðær Pallade and Marte, 32 gewæpnode gyt, ymbe heora fæder, 33 wlitigende ðara giganta limum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Vedea Nembròt a piè del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, e riguardar le genti 36 che ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.
query.error: **English:** 34 I saw Nimrod at the foot of the great work 35 as if bewildered, and looking at the people 36 who in Shinar with him were proud.
query.result: 34 Ic geseah Nembroð æt ðæs miclan weorces fótum 35 swilce forloren, and locian ða leoda 36 ðe on Sennaar mid him ofermodige wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 O Nïobè, con che occhi dolenti 38 vedea io te segnata in su la strada, 39 tra sette e sette tuoi figliuoli spenti!
query.error: **English:** 37 O Niobe, with what sorrowful eyes 38 I saw you depicted on the road, 39 between your seven and seven dead children!
query.result: 37 Eala Nióbè, mid hwylcum earmum eagum 38 ic ðe geseah on ðære stræte gestaðelod, 39 betwux ðinum seofon and seofon bearnum ofslegenum!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 O Saùl, come in su la propria spada 41 quivi parevi morto in Gelboè, 42 che poi non sentì pioggia né rugiada!
query.error: **English:** 40 O Saul, how on your own sword 41 you seemed dead there on Gilboa, 42 which then felt neither rain nor dew!
query.result: 40 Eala Saul, hú ðu on ðinum ágenum sweorde 41 ðær láge swá dead on Gelboè, 42 ðe síððan ne onfeng rén né deáw!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 O folle Aragne, sì vedea io te 44 già mezza ragna, trista in su li stracci 45 de l’opera che mal per te si fé.
query.error: **English:** 43 O foolish Arachne, I saw you there 44 already half a spider, sadly on the tatters 45 of the work that was ill-done for you.
query.result: 43 Eala dysige Aragne, ic ðe geseah ðær 44 nú healf wyrm, earmlic on ðám cláðum 45 ðæs weorces ðe yfele for ðe geworht wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 O Roboàm, già non par che minacci 47 quivi ’l tuo segno; ma pien di spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza ch’altri il cacci.
query.error: **English:** 46 O Rehoboam, your emblem here 47 no longer seems to threaten; but in fear 48 a chariot bears it, without others driving it.
query.result: 46 Eala Roboam, nu ne mæg ðin mægen 47 ðær ðin tacen beon; ac ðe on fleame 48 wægn ferið, butan ðe oðre drifon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Mostrava ancor lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fé caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.
query.error: **English:** 49 The hard pavement still showed 50 how dearly Alcmaeon had paid his mother 51 for the ill-omened ornament.
query.result: 49 Þæt hearda flor giet ða giet 50 hu ðeorlice Almeon his moder gebohte 51 þæt unfæle æht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Mostrava come i figli si gittaro 53 sovra Sennacherìb dentro dal tempio, 54 e come, morto lui, quivi il lasciaro.
query.error: **English:** 52 He showed how the sons threw themselves 53 upon Sennacherib inside the temple, 54 and how, after killing him, they left him there.
query.result: 52 He æteowde hu ða bearn wurpon 53 ofer Sennacherib innan ðam temple, 54 and hu, ða he dead wæs, ðær hine læfdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Mostrava la ruina e ’l crudo scempio 56 che fé Tamiri, quando disse a Ciro: 57 «Sangue sitisti, e io di sangue t’empio».
query.error: **English:** 55 It showed the ruin and the cruel slaughter 56 that Tomyris inflicted on Cyrus when she said to him: 57 "You thirsted for blood, and I fill you with blood."
query.result: 55 He frægn ðone herewæsman hwæt ða wuduhatan 56 ðurh ðone wudu ferdon, oððe hwæt ða wæron. 57 He cwæð ðæt ða wæron ða wuduwæsas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Mostrava come in rotta si fuggiro 59 li Assiri, poi che fu morto Oloferne, 60 e anche le reliquie del martiro.
query.error: **English:** 58 He showed how the Assyrians fled in rout 59 after Holofernes was killed, 60 and also the relics of the martyr.
query.result: 58 He æteowde hu on flyhte gewendon 59 ða Assyrii, siððan Holofernus wæs ofslegen, 60 and ða ðæs martyres reliquias.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Vedeva Troia in cenere e in caverne; 62 o Ilïón, come te basso e vile 63 mostrava il segno che lì si discerne!
query.error: **English:** 61 He saw Troy in ashes and in caverns; 62 O Ilium, how base and vile 63 the sign that is discerned there showed you to be!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Qual di pennel fu maestro o di stile 65 che ritraesse l’ombre e ’ tratti ch’ivi 66 mirar farieno uno ingegno sottile?
query.error: **English:** 64 What master of brush or pen 65 could portray the shadows and the lines 66 that there would make a subtle mind marvel?
query.result: 64 Hwilc wæs ðara wyrhta oððe ðara wordcræfta 65 ðe ða gesceaftas and ða hiw gewrit 66 ðe ðær gesewen hæfde an searocræftig mon?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Morti li morti e i vivi parean vivi: 68 non vide mei di me chi vide il vero, 69 quant’ io calcai, fin che chinato givi.
query.error: **English:** 67 The dead seemed dead and the living seemed alive: 68 no one who saw the truth saw more than I, 69 as I trod, until I went bowed down.
query.result: 67 Þa deadan ða deadan and ða lybbendan ða lybbendan ðuhton: 68 ne geseah næfre mare ðara ðe soð geseah, 69 swa ic ða geseah, oð ðæt ic abead niðer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Or superbite, e via col viso altero, 71 figliuoli d’Eva, e non chinate il volto 72 sì che veggiate il vostro mal sentero!
query.error: **English:** 70 Now lift up your heads, and with a haughty mien, 71 children of Eve, and do not bow your faces 72 so that you may see your evil path!
query.result: 70 Nu hefiað eowre heafdu and heora nebbu, 71 Efan Euan, and ne lætað eowre nebbu hangian, 72 ðæt ge geseon eowerne mislicne sið!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Più era già per noi del monte vòlto 74 e del cammin del sole assai più speso 75 che non stimava l’animo non sciolto,
query.error: **English:** 73 More of the mountain was already passed by us 74 and much more of the journey of the sun was spent 75 than my unfree spirit had reckoned,
query.result: 73 Mare wæs ða ðæs mundes oferwunnen 74 and ðæs sunnan stiges swiðe mare 75 ðonne min unspedige gast gedyde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 quando colui che sempre innanzi atteso 77 andava, cominciò: «Drizza la testa; 78 non è più tempo di gir sì sospeso.
query.error: **English:** 76 when he who always went on before us 77 began to say: "Lift up your head; 78 it is no longer time to go so slowly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Vedi colà un angel che s’appresta 80 per venir verso noi; vedi che torna 81 dal servigio del dì l’ancella sesta.
query.error: **English:** 79 See there an angel who prepares 80 to come towards us; see that the handmaid of the sixth hour 81 returns from the service of the day.
query.result: 79 Loca, þær is sum engel þe him ongen gegearwað 80 to cumenne ongean us; loca, hwær seo sixte stund 81 cymeð eft fram dæges þenunge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Di reverenza il viso e li atti addorna, 83 sì che i diletti lo ’nvïarci in suso; 84 pensa che questo dì mai non raggiorna!».
query.error: **English:** 82 Adorn your face and your actions with reverence, 83 so that your delights may lead you upward; 84 think that this day will never dawn again!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Io era ben del suo ammonir uso 86 pur di non perder tempo, sì che ’n quella 87 materia non potea parlarmi chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 85 I was well accustomed to his admonitions, 86 only so as not to waste time, so that in that 87 subject matter he could not speak to me obscurely.
query.result: 85 Ic wæs wel gewunod to his monungum, 86 ðurh ðæt ðe ic nolde ðone timan forleosan, swa ðæt he on ðære 87 spræce ne mihte ðurh digolnesse to me sprecan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 A noi venìa la creatura bella, 89 biancovestito e ne la faccia quale 90 par tremolando mattutina stella.
query.error: **English:** 88 Towards us came the beautiful creature, 89 clothed in white, and in her face such 90 that the trembling morning star appears.
query.result: 88 To us com ðæt fægere gewædu, 89 hwitum hræglum and on hiwe fæger 90 swa ðæt ðære morgensterre beofode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Le braccia aperse, e indi aperse l’ale; 92 disse: «Venite: qui son presso i gradi, 93 e agevolemente omai si sale.
query.error: **English:** 91 He spread his arms, and then he spread his wings; 92 he said: "Come: here are the steps nearby, 93 and now it is easy to climb."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 A questo invito vegnon molto radi: 95 o gente umana, per volar sù nata, 96 perché a poco vento così cadi?».
query.error: **English:** 94 To this invitation very few come: 95 O human race, born to fly upward, 96 why do you fall so easily at a little wind?
query.result: 94 To ðisum lade ðær cumeð swiðe feawe: 95 Ea, mennisc cyn, ðu eart gesceapen to fleonne ufan, 96 hwi feallest ðu swa hrædlice for lytlum winde?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Come a man destra, per salire al monte 101 dove siede la chiesa che soggioga 102 la ben guidata sopra Rubaconte,
query.error: **English:** 100 As a man on the right, to climb the mountain 101 where sits the church that subjugates 102 the well-guided city above Rubaconte,
query.result: 100 Swa swa man on ðære swiðran healfe, ðe ðone munt astigeð 101 ðær ðæt cyrcan sitteð ðe oferðigeð 102 ða wel-gegyrlan burh ofer Rubacunte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 si rompe del montar l’ardita foga 104 per le scalee che si fero ad etade 105 ch’era sicuro il quaderno e la doga;
query.error: **English:** 103 breaks the bold eagerness to climb 104 because of the stairs that were made in an age 105 when the ledger and the cask were secure;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 così s’allenta la ripa che cade 107 quivi ben ratta da l’altro girone; 108 ma quinci e quindi l’alta pietra rade.
query.error: **English:** 106 so the bank that falls here 107 is very steep from the other circle; 108 but on this side and that the high rock scrapes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Noi volgendo ivi le nostre persone, 110 ‘Beati pauperes spiritu!’ voci 111 cantaron sì, che nol diria sermone.
query.error: **English:** 109 Turning our persons there, 110 “Blessed are the poor in spirit!” voices 111 sang so that no speech could tell it.
query.result: 109 We wendon ða ðær ure weg, 110 “Eadige ða earman on gaste!” stefna 111 sungon swa ðæt nænig spræc ne mæg getellan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Ahi quanto son diverse quelle foci 113 da l’infernali! ché quivi per canti 114 s’entra, e là giù per lamenti feroci.
query.error: **English:** 112 Ah, how different are those entrances 113 from the infernal ones! For here one enters 114 with songs, and there below with fierce lamentations.
query.result: 112 Eala, hu micel is ðara stowa gecynd 113 fram hellicum! Forðæm ðe ðær man in gæð 114 mid sangum, and ðær niðer mid reðum heofum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Già montavam su per li scaglion santi, 116 ed esser mi parea troppo più lieve 117 che per lo pian non mi parea davanti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Now I was climbing the holy stairs, 116 and it seemed to me that it was much easier 117 than it had seemed to me on the plain below.
query.result: 115 Þa ic stigende wæs ða halgan stæger, 116 and me ðuhte ðæt wære ðæs leohtlicor 117 ðonne hit me ær ðuhte on ðam beorglande.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, qual cosa greve 119 levata s’è da me, che nulla quasi 120 per me fatica, andando, si riceve?».
query.error: **English:** 118 And I: "Master, tell me, what heavy thing 119 has been lifted from me, that almost nothing 120 is felt as fatigue by me, as I go?".
query.result: 118 And ic: "Lareow, sege me, hwilc ðing swære 119 of me ahafen is, ðæt me nis ðæs swiðe 120 earfoðe to ðolian, ðe ic ðurh ðas dimman stige?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Rispuose: «Quando i P che son rimasi 122 ancor nel volto tuo presso che stinti, 123 saranno, com’ è l’un, del tutto rasi,
query.error: **English:** 121 He replied: "When the P's that are left 122 on your face, almost erased, 123 will be, like the first, completely erased,
query.result: 121 He andswarode: "Þonne ða P ðe syndon læfede 122 gyt on ðinum ansyne nean alysde, 123 beoð, swa swa ðæt an, ealle arasde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 fier li tuoi piè dal buon voler sì vinti, 125 che non pur non fatica sentiranno, 126 ma fia diletto loro esser sù pinti».
query.error: **English:** 124 your feet will be so conquered by good will 125 that they will not only feel no fatigue, 126 but it will be a delight for them to be spurred on."
query.result: 124 beoð ðine fet fram ðam godan willan swa oferwunnen, 125 ðæt hi næfre ne ondrædað swinc, 126 ac him bið wynsum ðæt hi beoð uppe astigende."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Allor fec’ io come color che vanno 128 con cosa in capo non da lor saputa, 129 se non che ’ cenni altrui sospecciar fanno;
query.error: **English:** 127 Then I did like those who go 128 with something on their head that they do not know about, 129 except that the gestures of others make them suspect;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 per che la mano ad accertar s’aiuta, 131 e cerca e truova e quello officio adempie 132 che non si può fornir per la veduta;
query.error: **English:** 130 so that the hand helps to make sure, 131 and it searches and finds and performs that task 132 which cannot be accomplished by sight;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 e con le dita de la destra scempie 134 trovai pur sei le lettere che ’ncise 135 quel da le chiavi a me sovra le tempie:
query.error: **English:** 133 and with the fingers of my right hand, one by one, 134 I found the six letters that he of the keys 135 had incised on my temples:
query.result: 133 and mid ðara swiðran fingrum anum 134 ic funde ða sex stafas þe onwrat 135 se þe ða cægas hæfde ofer mine slæpas:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 a che guardando, il mio duca sorrise.
query.error: **English:** 136 at which, looking, my leader smiled.
query.result: 136 on ða ic locode, ða min latteow lohh.
